job_title: Full Time Faculty in San Antonio, TX
pros: The College itself is not bad. It is a good environment and the staff are great. If you are faculty, the students are great. The benefits and pay are good, though not as good as comparable instutitions in the region. It is a Catholic school, but there is no hard sell on religion. If you are not Catholic, it is okay. Your beliefs or lack thereof will be respected.
cons:
As faculty, it really depends on the department. Depts are pretty autonomous. Some depts are led by tyrants or worse and others depts are not. Religion/theology is not a good department to work in especially for people of color. Senior faculty in that dept. simply have a different set of standards for minority scholars. (For instance, they have never tenured an American minority scholar--i.e., African American, Mexican American, or Native American in the department's over 100 years of existence. They do actively recruit immigrant and liberal Protestant scholars, however. They just have an issue with so-called colonized minorities.) 
Also, the dept likes to run afoul of the local Catholic Bishop due to faux woke Protestant (not Catholic) liberation theology. If you are an European Catholic with a doctorate from a Catholic school, you are golden. It will be a good dept for you. If you aren't, don't waste your time applying. Go to another institution that will treat you with respect.

pros: Flexibility to work from home
cons: Low pay, but good benefits

review_title: Beautiful school with great mission- room for improvement
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Worcester, MA
pros: Offers some creative freedom for course design, students held to rigorous standards- teaching is intensive; very nice facilities; decent support for non tenure track faculty in terms of internal grant opportunities and professional development
cons: The school atmosphere can feel very stiff, stifling and unfriendly (for example, saying hello to someone in the halls will not elicit a response around half the time). They have diversity and inclusion issues but are trying to improve this area. In terms of faculty labor power, they do not have a union and the board essentially controls all major decisions. For example, pension contributions were cut without notice as a result of covid austerity measures- while they continued construction on multimillion dollar building. For non tenure track faculty, the contracts are “at will” (a weak commitment that is characterized by precarity and inherently anxiety producing). It seems the board is driven to impose weakening labor conditions whenever possible.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Worcester, MA
pros: good salary, benefit and supportive advisers. I worked here for a year and half, I learned so much from all the other faculty members.
cons: isolated locations. The college is in Worcester, central Mass. Worcester has a high crime rate and the city is not relatively safe especially at night. Drug abuse is another issue.

review_title: Excellent place to work while a college student.
job_title: Bookstore Sales Associate in Worcester, MA
pros: Flexible hours, very friendly atmosphere, spent all 4 years working here and by the end felt as though we were family.
cons: Not able to do schoolwork during downtime like you can in many other work-study positions, and the workload balance can be very uneven depending on the day.

review_title: This is a great job for college students.
pros: It is the most coveted job on campus available to students. The job is low stress and fun.  If it's not busy and not much work for you to do, you can watch movies or do work. There is a computer with full internet access. Plus they have a tv there to let you watch a movie.
cons: The job can get lonely. The pay is fairly low. The timesheets are messy.

pros: Staff is very friendly and communicative. HR has not had any issues with direct deposit and keeps direct deposit over different semesters.
cons: Almost too much meeting and planning for what we are doing. Sometimes spend half of the time billed for planning to do the job instead of doing it.

pros: Good work study opportunities.  Worked in several parts of the college. The best was as a caller for Phonathon.  Flexible hours and bonuses.  Provided meals
cons: There were not many cons.  Ig you dislike cold calling it is not for you.  One night they had breakfast for dinner.  It was not that enjoyable.  Overall there are not a lot of cons.
